title: Interpreter and Translator of the Chinese/English languages
description: A Court-certified legal interpreter for depositions, arbitrations, mediations, trials and other court proceedings with more than 16 years of experience. Mimi is fluent in Mandarin, Cantonese and Shanghainese <> English. Services for conferences and focus groups upon request.. Mimi specializes in providing interpreting and translation services in technical patent litigations involving various technologies. .

title: Professional and Certified Legal Interpreter
description: Technologies interpreted include but not limited to: semiconductor technologies, DRAM, circuitry design, CRT, LCD, LED panel technologies, Wireless Communication, video-on-demand, cable television, GPS, cellular technology, pharmaceutical and other technologies. Interpretation of complex business litigation, negotiations, antitrust and educational lectures; major cases include ITC hearings, major Federal and State court cases. WIRTTEN TRANSLATION & TRANSCRIPTION Over 30,000 pages of Certified Legal and Business Documents Technical Manuals Summary translations for documents in discoveries Transcription of Audio &/or Video Tapes

name: Cameron Lau
education: [{"name"=>"University of California, Santa Barbara", "description"=>"", "period"=>"2011 – 2013"}]
summary: Hello my name is Cameron, I'm a linguist and language specialist. Language is everything. We use it to communicate via verbally, written or signing. It holds cultural significances and even alters and expands the way we think. I knew this at a very young age as I was raised in a very cultural household that speaks three languages. It is the reason why I spent four years learning the way language works, changes, used and learned. It simply fascinates me and drives me with passion. Translating and interpreting are but two skill sets I have. I speak English, Cantonese, and Mandarin fluently, with strong understandings of Japanese, Spanish, German and the Korean alphabet. Because of expansive knowledge of the subject matter I am able to arbitrate any trepidation that may arise during activities. I have studied the IPA (International Phonetic Alphabet) and have firm grasp in the phonetic notation and all its features. Aside from my education in languages and linguistics, I am familiar with all basic Microsoft Office tools and have excellent communication and people skills, including presentation and public speaking. A current teacher with experience of almost three years, therefore management abilities has been attained through experience. Capable of leading, with the comprehension of the team concept. Please email me at cameronlau@live.com to know more.

title: Sergeant First Class/E-7, U. S. Army
company: United States Army / United States Army Reserve
description: Enlisted in the U. S. Army in 1986 on active duty in the Infantry for over three years and joined the U. S. Army Reserve since 1990. Qualified in Infantry, Airborne, Linguist, Instructor, Psychological Warfare Specialist, Retention and Military Intelligence, Top Secret (SCI) Security Clearance. Served in these capacities in various units Stateside and numerous oversea assignments. Achieved the rank of Sergeant First Class / E-7. Positions as Team Sergeant, Senior Team Sergeant, Small Arms Instructor, Defense Language Program Manager, Intelligence NCO, Retention NCO, Operation NCO and Training NCO. United States Department of Defense and Department of the Army Linguist in Chinese Mandarin and Chinese Cantonese. International Military Parachute Jump Tours with various organizations since 1992, qualified and earned paratrooper/jump badges of over twenty-five countries world wide. Retired from the U. S. Army and the U. S. Army Reserve for over twenty-eight years of combine services in January 2015.

summary: Linguist and proprietor of Lingua Skills, a translation agency specialised in providing high quality translations to market research companies. Languages covered: - All Western & Eastern uropean languages - Arabic & Hebrew - Oriental languages incl. Japanese, Mandarin, Cantonese, Thai & Korean - Translation of questionnaires, discussion guides, reports and presentations. - Overtyping of CATI, CAPI and web scripts. - Translations in ConfirmIt - Translation of verbatim responses - Proofreading and/or editing of client translations - Online proofreading/testing of web survey scripts - Coding of Dutch, Flemish, French, Italian & Spanish verbatim responses For further information and rates contact me on hariette@easynet.co.ukSpecialties:Translations by people with knowledge and appreciation of the specific issues and requirements surrounding the translation of documents for market research purposes.

name: Rachel, Ka Ying Tsui
education: [{"name"=>"The University of Hong Kong", "description"=>"", "period"=>"2013 – 2014"}, {"name"=>"University of California, Berkeley", "description"=>"", "period"=>"2011 – 2013"}]
summary: Having a passion for linguistics has led me to keep pursuing a research career in fields related to linguistics and to learn more about current trends in linguistic research. I am interested in and have ample knowledge of experimental phonetics, particularly in categorical perception concerning how people make distinctions between contrastive sounds—native or nonnative—and how such classification affects individuals’ phonetic inventory. I have also obtained a good knowledge of issues concerning the studies of psycholinguistics and neurolinguistics, especially on neurodevelopment for language processing, from my previous work at a neurolinguistics laboratory.

education: [{"name"=>"university of zuerich linguistic", "description"=>"", "period"=>""}]
summary: Trained as a conservator and restorer of paintings (oil on wood panels and canvas) polychrome sculptures. Specializing in contemporary and modern chinese paintings, since in Hong Kong. I use my passion for pure colors(pigments) and my visual talent for starting Pdaltd, which specialize in special painting for interior.Work all over Asia.(1988) Painted Disney Tarzan tree Attraction in HK. Start to produce her own paintings and sculpures, preparing a photographic exhibition. My other passion for animals and people with special skills in remote areas pushed me to start to produce socially responsable objects with rare materials and skills, from different asian countries. This has being started in 1992. Design animal products and furniture. The process continue and it is a fantastic ride....Specialties:Conservation and restoration of contemporary painting . Care of the collections, menagement of collections,purchase and resale of artwork for clients.Care of traveling collection. I think in picture and see in chromatic composition. Creating the best where possible., visionary creator and maker .....the complete process with humour and respect for the whole. Speak and write:italian, french, german, spanish,portuguese, english, read old greak and latin. studies:mandarin and cantonese

title: Owner and Director
name: Lisa Shao
summary: Professionally qualified and highly experienced linguist/teacher/translator/consultant with solid experience in Chinese and English language training and services, Chinese and English cultural studies as well as general and business etiquette training, with standard classical native Chinese Mandarin & Cantonese speaking, fluent to native, accent free English. Language & etiquette training and translation services provided directly to clients with tailor-made learning solutions at all levels with 1-1 tuition, group lessons and online/Skype learning. Speech & presentation, editing & dissertation, all level Chinese and English exam preparations all available upon request. In addition, business/investment/trade communication and consultancy services also provided with knowledge achieved in Project Finance, Private Wealth/Asset Management and Luxury through international business development/sales & marketing career in London. High quality teaching/training with clear, easy-to-understand explanation on difficult grammar points, reading comprehension, vocabulary and writing, proven expertise on oral and listening comprehension, accurate pronunciation and tone correction, accent polishing to native will ensure you learn really well and master the skills and techniques of beautiful, accent-free native Chinese Mandarin and Cantonese speaking alongside fluent native English! Exact know-how of Chinese general and business etiquette training will enable you to do well, with high confidence, in dealing with the global Chinese world and markets! From past to present clients have included government officials, corporate business executives such as CEOs, CFOs and COOs/senior employees, ultra-high-net-worth business owners and their family members, banking/finance/real estate/legal/media/IT/medical research professionals, academics and consultants, artists and writers, architects, charity organizations, graduates and students from high profile high-net-worth families etc..

title: Conference Interpreter
description: As an independent conference interpreter, I have provided solid, professional simultaneous and consecutive services at over 200 meetings, negotiations, symposiums, summits, and training sessions. Clients can always count on me for effective communication not just of their information, but their intent and ideas. A language: Mandarin and Cantonese B language: English Based in Shanghai; will travel as required. My areas of expertise include: - Finance and investment - Energy, green tech - IT - Automobile - Business negotiations, banquets, press conferences, product launches, meet-n-greets with government officials, and other high-profile events. Event highlights: Finance: - Commodity and Managed Futures Workshop, co-hosted by Chicago Mercantile Exchange - Conference on Competition, Compliance, and Cooperation: China’s Emergence in International Finance; interpreted for prominent figures such as LIU Mingkang, Chair of CBRC; Hu Shuli, Editor-in-Chief of Caixin Media and executives of SWIFT. - Corporate access for Kyniko, Paradice, Eton Park, Tiger Asia and TT International, Norges Bank Investment Management, etc. Energy and Green Tech: - UN-HABITAT – Green Habitat Forum - Roots and Shoots 15th anniversary and YES International Forum - Asia LNG Forum IT: - Huawei Cloud Congress - UXPA (The User Experience Professionals Association) workshop - Game Connection’s master class Automobile: - AutoMechanica Shanghai and NextGen Auto International Summit in China - Volvo press conference and product launch - Miserati press conference To make an inquiry or request for further information, please call +86 18621859233 or email me at Rachel.rluo@gmail.com.

title: Specialist
company: Shanghai Disney Resort/The Walt Disney Company
description: • Interpreted for the leadership in 61 meetings, high-level & technical, for various departments, including Business Development, Legal, Public Affairs, HR, Finance, Corporate Alliance and Operating Participants; Took concise and well-structured meeting minutes. • Translated over 150,000 words of documents, including contracts, other legal documents, statements,monthly/quarterly/semi-annual presentations, and correspondence. • Proofread over 280,000 words. • Worked with Contract Administration to source translation vendors; interfaced with vendors; developed a document outsourcing and quality control process. • Interfaced with various departments and external stakeholders (the Chinese shareholder and government bodies); offered cultural insights and maintained relationships.

description: Providing English Language support and Study Skills for International students via classes and tutorials. Also designed an Independent Study Area on Moodle to help students (Home + international) 24/7 via a one-stop shop of 600 links to 20,000 resources. Created an English Language testing instrument called SMELTAR (Swansea Metropolitan English Language Test of Academic Readiness) now upgraded to UWELTS (University of Wales TSD English Language Test. This new test is about to go live in March 2015 and will be benchmarked marked against IELTS or similar accredited tests.

title: Assistant G.M.
description: 1. Assist General Manager in making and carrying out kinds of work plans, and appropriately arrange unplanned affairs involving Chairman; 2. Timely handle documents, reports, letters in need of General Manager’s review, approval; 3. Positively transmit General Manager’s indications within the company, organize meetings and take minutes; 4. Research, collect and provide GM with industry’s management, technical and market information; 5. Translate contracts, standards, and other kinds of documents into English or Chinese; 6. Provide interpretation when dealing with foreign affairs, such as in the reception of customers and visitors; 7. Audit department managers’ work on behalf of General Manager; 8. Evaluate and verify employee’s constructive proposals; 9. Deal with public relations such as the government, industry association, and news media. Accomplishments: 1) In 2014, as project group member, thoroughly participated in the construction, trial running,acceptance check of ECO-PAR new workshop. 2) In Jan., 2013, successfully planned and organized the company’s tenth anniversary celebration party in Guanlan Shanshuitianyuan Tourism Culture Garden.

title: HR & Admin Manager
description: 1. Formulated, modified, implemented, and monitored the implementation of company management rules and regulations; 2. Made HR planning, carried out recruitment and training activities; 3. Formulated and carried out the compensation and benefit, performance evaluation principles, and incentive measures; 4. Carried out staff’s monthly and annual performance evaluation; 5. Planned and implemented company’s overall safety, fire management and maintenance; 6. Managed and maintained all office facilities, environment and office supplies; 7. Took charge of the management and maintenance of canteen, vehicles, dormitories; 8. Implemented ISO9001 & ISO14001 Management Programs within the department; 9. Dealt with public relation issues such as government, customer plant audit and etc.; 10. Constructed enterprise culture, planned and organized employee activities; 11. Managed and retained employee relationship, handled labor disputes. Accomplishments: 1) In Jan., 2012, took back the canteen from subcontractor and run with our own team, succeeded to reduce canteen costs while improving food quality and employee satisfaction; formulated the compensation structure, changing piece rate into hourly wage for workers, reduced worker turnover led by discontent due to group leader’s unfair wage distribution. 2) In 2012,built up the intranet to make the management be open, transparent, and visible. 3) In 2011, perfected the recruitment and training procedures, built up enterprise talent pool. 4) In 2010, established employee club along with a mini library for study after work.

title: Secretary to GM/Deputy HR & Admin Manager
description: 1. Assisted General Manager in daily management, handled documents, coordinated and communicated with department managers; 2. Followed up with R&D projects, communicated with mother company in the U.S. regarding technical issues; 3. Translated contracts, technical documents into English or Chinese; 4. Provided oral translation for foreign visitors and foreign engineer working at the factory; 5. Organized and made preparation for overseas lighting exhibitions; 6. Coordinated and handled general trade import business; 7. Assisted GM in hotel, flight, visa issues for business trips. Since Jun. 2008 onward, had also been working as Deputy HR & Admin Manager, taking charge of company culture construction, technical, senior personnel recruitment. Accomplishments: 1) In 2009, compiled the employee handbook.. 2) In 2003-2004, organized and completed the transfer of aircraft lamp production from US Largo factory to Shenzhen plant. 3) In 2006, participated in the introduction and installation of xenon flash lamp production line.
